title: PM Modi extends Chhath greetings
content: The Prime Minister also shared a song by noted singer Sharda Sinha, whose soulful renditions add to the festival fervour

title: Democracy ‘alien concept’ for Pakistan, must end rights abuses in occupied areas: India
content: Parvathaneni Harish underlined that the Global South must have a greater voice in global decision-making

title: Man involved in illegal arms supply injured in encounter in Delhi's Mehrauli
content: A case under relevant provisions of law has been registered against Kanishk alias Koku alias Vishal (27), a resident of Madangir, Delhi

title: Four militants involved in extortion activities arrested in Manipur
content: One pistol with ammunition was recovered from his possession, and he was involved in extortion and the collection of funds from the town area of Churachandpur, says a senior police officer

title: Maharashtra leaders seek SIT, independent inquiry into woman doctor’s death
content: The doctor, hailing from Beed district and posted at a government hospital in Phaltan, was found dead in a hotel room

title: Delhi govt to implement uniform admission age of 6+ years for Class 1 from 2026-27
content: According to a circular issued by the Directorate of Education (DoE), the foundational stage currently comprises two classes — Nursery and KG — followed by Class 1, with minimum ages for admission being 3+, 4+ and 5+ years, respectively

title: Indian national working as staff nurse jailed for molesting male visitor at Singapore hospital
content: Elipe Siva Nagu, 34, molested a male visitor to the Raffles Hospital in June, after claiming that he wanted to “disinfect” the victim.

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Modi, Shah reaffirm NDA will fight polls under Nitish Kumar’s leadership
content: Law and order cannot exist when the RJD is in power, the Prime Minister said. “During the RJD’s rule, extortion, murder, ransom, and kidnapping flourished in Bihar as an industry. RJD’s jungle raj has ruined many generations in Bihar,”

title: Speeding car runs over pedestrians in Agra; 5 killed, 2 injured
content: The accident occurred in the New Agra police station area, near Nagla Budhi, ahead of the Central Hindi Institute

title: Odisha on high alert ahead of cyclone, fishermen advised caution
content: While the cyclone is not expected to make a direct landfall in Odisha, it is still likely to cause widespread downpours and gusty winds

title: The orthodontist who built a museum of cameras in Chennai
content: Dr. Arun’s passion has, over the years, grown into a collection of about 5,800 still photography cameras, earning him a Guinness World Record for the largest collection of cameras and the most distinctive assemblage of film cameras

title: Governor, CM, Ministers pay tributes to late Marudhu brothers on their death anniversary
content: Ministers Thangam Thennarasu, Ma. Subramanian and P.K. Sekarbabu; Chennai Mayor R. Priya; MP Thamizhachi Thangapandian and senior officials paid floral tributes to late Marudhu brothers in Gandhi Mandapam campus in Chennai

title: Maiden flight of HTT-40 series production aircraft
content: The HTT-40 is an indigenous Basic Trainer Aircraft (BTA) designed and developed by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) for the Indian Air Force (IAF)

title: CPI(M) seeks to ease tensions with CPI over PM-SHRI MoU
content: UDF, seemingly sensing a political opportunity, invited CPI to join the Opposition coalition. “The UDF will welcome CPI if the latter chooses to break ranks with the CPI(M)”, UDF convenor Adoor Prakash stated.

title: Trouble in ‘soy State’: Madhya Pradesh soybean farmers lose interest over multiple factors
content: Madhya Pradesh is India’s largest soybean producer, but young farmers are losing interest in farming, facing key issues such as improper implementation of minimum support price, seed quality, input cost and the possibility of the import of soybean and soybean meal from the United States. A.M. Jigeesh reports on a brewing crisis

title: Anganwadi workers’ union demands gratuity for retired employees
content: The government’s decision to provide gratuity to those who retire after 2023 should be modified and the gratuity should be applicable to all those who joined the service from 1975 and retired from 2011-12

title: BJP accuses Bengal Govt. of creating ‘fake citizens’ in border districts
content: The party claimed that these certificates are being used to create “fake voters” ahead of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls

title: Not-for-profit forum to be launched to address cyber challenges
content: The inaugural conclave of the forum was organised by alumni of Cyber Law & Cyber Forensics Programme, NLSIU

title: In a reform push, U.P. CM Yogi approves fivefold increase in the financial powers of PWD officers
content: In the revised structure, the Chief Engineer can now approve works up to ₹10 crores, up from ₹2 crores

title: It was a mistake to join hands with RJD: Nitish
content: The JD(U) president addressed a rally in Samastipur district, from where the Prime Minister launched his campaign for the high-stakes elections

title: Pregnant woman among other migrants languish in Bangladesh even after Calcutta High Court order; Trinamool points fingers at Centre
content: It has been four weeks since the Calcutta High Court directed authorities to bring back the six migrant workers who were pushed into Bangladesh months back

title: Lokesh pitches Andhra–Victoria cricket ties, eyes IPL-level talent pipeline
content: During a visit to Melbourne, HRD Minister explores joint training camps, eco-friendly stadiums, and digital fan engagement, as Andhra’s cricketing ambitions gain global traction through the APL and IPL 2025 prospects

title: Japan’s new PM commits to higher defence spend, ties with India, Quad
content: Sanae Takaichi said she ‘looks forward’ to promoting the Japan-India Strategic and Global Partnership; ‘in order to promote the main pillar of Tokyo’s diplomacy, a Free and Open Indo-Pacific, India is a crucial partner,’ says an Assistant Minister

title: India is a crucial partner on Indo-Pacific; PM Takaichi committed to building ties: Japanese government spokesperson
content: PM Takaichi expected to continue foreign policy of predecessors; immigration hard-line sparks concerns

title: 103 bus stops in Bengaluru to be relocated to ease traffic congestion
content: The list of “traffic-causing” bus shelters has been sent to the Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA), which will direct the five new municipal corporations to oversee the relocation of bus stops within their jurisdictions.

title: Tax saving drives private bus operators to use out-of-State vehicles
content: Telangana has less than 100 private long-distance buses, buses registered in other parts of the country are used to plying long-distance routes so as to save on the tax component; once an All-India Permit is available, operators can ply buses on all available routes, a senior transport officer said

title: Judicial panel to begin inquiry into Leh violence from October 25
content: Justice B.S. Chauhan-led commission to record statements over deaths of four civilians during September protests

title: ECI mandates disclosure tag on AI-generated campaign videos
content: The ECI says it has been brought to its notice that the misuse of hyper-realistic synthetically generated information, including depicting political leaders as making electorally sensitive messages, is contaminating the level-playing field in the electoral arena, disrupting fair and equal conditions for all political participants.

title: Jays use 9-run 6th to stomp Dodgers in Game 1
content: Addison Barger launched the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history, Alejandro Kirk added a two-run homer in a nine-run sixth inning and the Toronto Blue Jays overwhelmed the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers 11-4 in Friday night's opener.

title: Blazers glum but move forward after Billups' arrest
content: Few players wanted to talk before the Blazers' game Friday night against the Warriors, one day after the arrest of head coach Chauncey Billups in an alleged poker scheme.

title: NBA's Silver 'deeply disturbed' by indictments
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he was "deeply disturbed" by the allegations that were presented by federal authorities against Heat guard Terry Rozier and Blazers coach Chauncey Billups.

title: UNT QB Mestemaker has record 608 yards in win
content: Redshirt freshman Drew Mestemaker passed for a school-record 608 yards with four touchdowns and North Texas scored 37 unanswered points to beat Charlotte 54-20 on Friday night.

title: Sources: Storm to hire Liberty's Raman as coach
content: Liberty assistant Sonia Raman has agreed to a multiyear deal to become the new head coach of the Seattle Storm, sources told ESPN on Friday.

title: MLBPA chief: NBA scandal raises safety concerns
content: MLBPA chief Tony Clark said concerns for player safety are "greater" in the wake of another sports gambling scandal hitting the NBA this week.

title: Giants, Daboll, Skattebo all fined over Dart exam
content: The Giants were assessed a $200,000 fine for violating the concussion protocol around an exam of quarterback Jaxon Dart, while coach Brian Daboll was fined $100,000 and RB Cam Skattebo $15,000 for conduct detrimental to the league.

title: Messi gets Golden Boot, scores brace in Miami win
content: Inter Miami star Lionel Messi was presented with his Major League Soccer Golden Boot award by commissioner Don Garber during a brief, on-field ceremony before his team's 3-1 victory over Nashville SC in Game 1 of the first-round playoff series.

title: UFC 321: Inside Tom Aspinall's unique heavyweight strategy
content: Tom Aspinall and his father and coach, Andy, have developed a strategy that has yet to be truly tested.

title: NBA gambling investigation live updates: Latest arrests, statements, more
content: Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups, Heat guard Terry Rozier and former Cavs player Damon Jones have been arrested in connection with the probes.

title: 12 more NFL Week 8 games: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: Aaron Rodgers vs. Green Bay? Can Bills and Ravens get back on track? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 8 game.

title: Aaron Rodgers at home with Steelers, at peace with Packers
content: There's a fire still burning inside the QB who's happy in Pittsburgh but respectful of his time in Green Bay.

title: Mbappé vs. Yamal is the new Ronaldo vs. Messi -- so which Clasico star is better?
content: Not since Messi vs. Ronaldo has the Barcelona-Real Madrid rivalry given us a matchup like Yamal vs. Mbappe. So, which superstar would you rather have?

title: Madrid vs. Barça head-to-head, form, key clashes, predictions, odds
content: When Real Madrid and Barcelona face off, there's nothing bigger happening anywhere in the soccer world.

title: NFC East roundtable: Can the defending champs take the division crown again?
content: So far, every team in the NFC East except the Eagles has played three division games. Here's how they stack up.

title: Giants-Eagles rivalry and the punt that lives in NFL infamy
content: DeSean Jackson and Matt Dodge relive a 15-year-old shank and a walk-off return that fans will never forget.

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: Shock USWNT loss shows lack of problem-solving, but no cause for alarm (yet)
content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

title: Piastri: Norris & I have 'clean slate' in Mexico
content: Oscar Piastri has confirmed that he and McLaren teammate Lando Norris are starting from a "clean slate" at the Mexican Grand Prix after the Australian took responsibility for their collision at the U.S. Grand Prix.

title: Norris laughs off Red Bull sticky tape 'side quests'
content: Lando Norris has laughed off Red Bull's attempts to remove tape from the pit wall that he was using as a visual aid to ensure his car was not too far forward in its grid slot.

title: NBA intel: Wemby's new game plan, and early concerns for Lakers and Rockets
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst take the pulse of the league after a thrilling first few nights of 2025-26.

title: Amir Abdur-Rahim's legacy lives on 1 year after his sudden passing
content: Those closest to the late South Florida coach remember him one year after his death shocked college basketball.

title: Top 100 men's NCAA basketball players going into 2025-26
content: From seniors who have taken the national stage before to freshmen entering the spotlight, here is our 1-100.

title: Bilas' 2025 preseason All-America teams
content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: Grateful Ducks: Oregon's Grateful Dead uniforms top best Week 9 threads in college football
content: The crowd theme for Oregon's game against Wisconsin this week is tie-dye, and the Ducks are incorporating a number of Grateful Dead motifs into their uniforms.

title: Last-minute pickups: Bucs duo of Tez Johnson, Cade Otton among top Week 8 options
content: If this heavy bye week or injuries have you seeking lineup help, we have available options to consider.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Colts, Patriots among top options in Week 8
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 8, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bournemouth ask clubs for £75m to sign Semenyo
content: Clubs like Chelsea and Liverpool will have to pay over £75 million in order to sign Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bengaluru–Hyderabad travellers demand more train options after Kurnool bus fire tragedy
content: Currently, a total of 28 trains operate between the two capitals on different days and timings, including the Yesvantpur–Kacheguda Vande Bharat Express, according to railway officials.

title: Shahabad struggle: NDA prepares to regain lost ground in former bastion
content: While the alliance won 19 of 22 seats in the 2010 election, its tally dropped to just two seats in 2020 in the region where political dynamics is heavily influenced by the Kushwaha and Rajput communities; this time, the BJP is contesting nine seats, the JD(U) eight, the RLM two, and the LJP (RV) three

title: Zubeen Garg death: Assam SIT hopeful of Singapore’s help
content: The Special Investigating Team went to the island country to seek CCTV footage and statements from those who had accompanied the Assamese cultural icon on the yacht on the day he died

title: Kurnool tragedy: Mother and son from Bengaluru among the victims
content: The Karnataka government has sent a team of officials from the Transport Department to Kurnool in Andhra Pradesh. The officials have been instructed to identify victims from Karnataka and extend necessary assistance to their families

title: Chandrababu Naidu discusses bilateral trade, AI-based citizen services with UAE leaders
content: Food security, logistics, transportation, and infrastructure investment opportunities also come up for discussion; at a Telugu diaspora event, the Chief Minister highlights the role of the Telugus in supporting Andhra Pradesh’s growth and global collaborations

title: RBI to establish regional office in Amaravati
content: The new office will be developed in approximately 1.6 lakh square feet, with an overall investment exceeding ₹200 crore to strengthen the bank’s operational capabilities and services in the region

title: Engrossed in power fight, Congress leaders have forgotten their responsibilities, says Union Minister
content: Taking exception to what he termed as degrading language in political criticism, the Union Minister says the people of both Karnataka and Telangana were closely observing the developments and they would soon teach them a lesson

title: Samajwadi Party plans region-centric manifestos to counter BJP's narrative in Uttar Pradesh
content: Party strategists entrusted with the responsibility argue that each region has different geographical, economic challenges and opportunities, and addressing it will be the focus of the SP’s localised manifestos. The party will however release a State-level manifesto too.

title: ‘Vision 2031’ stresses on increased power generation, climate-resilient power infrastructure and new technologies
content: The draft document outlines the department’s plans for modernisation of existing hydropower projects, fostering e-mobility initiatives and the seamless integration of renewable energy and energy storage mechanisms into the Kerala power system

title: Civet coffee’s unique flavour linked to fat composition, finds Central University of Kerala study
content: Civet-processed beans are larger and contains higher fat contents than manually collected ones. Elevated level of caprylic acid and capric acid methyl esters, compounds responsible for coffee’s creamy aroma and enhanced flavour, found in civet-proceed beans, according to study

title: Paddy procurement touches record levels amidst bumper harvest in Delta districts
content: Across the districts, the procurement has increased by several times and official machinery has also transported record quantity of the produce to storage points and hulling centres

title: Bus accidents in Andhra Pradesh led to 115 deaths in 2023, a decrease from 221 deaths in 2022
content: Bus accidents in Andhra Pradesh resulted in 1.41% of the deaths due to road accidents in 2023, whereas two-wheelers resulted in over 50% of deaths due to road accidents

title: Congress, BJP spar over OBC politics in Bihar
content: Congress says Karpoori Thakur govt. fell in Bihar in late 1970s as Jan Sangh withdrew support over OBC quota, while   BJP reminds Congress of how it humiliated OBC leader Sitaram Kesri

title: Agriculture Department advises steps to rejuvenate crops damaged by heavy rains
content: Officials emphasise need for quick drainage of rainwater, timely fungicide application, and balanced fertilisation to mitigate losses and restore productivity

title: Rajnath meets Army commanders, reviews security situation
content: During the conference, detailed deliberations were held with the senior leadership of the Army on key aspects, including grey zone warfare, the roadmap for jointness, Aatmanirbharta and innovation.

title: World Bank approves over 2,450-cr. loan for health system improvement in Kerala
content: The programme will ensure a 40% increase in patients whose hypertension is controlled and 60% increase in cervical and breast cancer screening for women to accelerate efforts to end preventable deaths

title: Experts urge students to blend skills and knowledge at seminar in Bapatla
content: Speakers from SRM University–AP and The Hindu FIC highlight the importance of communication, continuous learning, and career clarity for engineering students

title: CPI registers profound disquiet over Kerala government keeping LDF and Cabinet in the dark about PM SHRI MoU
content: Party State secretary criticised General Education Minister V. Sivankutty for showing “undue haste” in signing the MoU without the cabinet’s or LDF’s approval. At the same time, he signalled that the CPI was willing to give the government a breather

title: Supreme Court to hear contempt plea over lawyer’s attack on CJI Bench
content: Chief Justice Gavai had himself brushed off the incident as inconsequential and a “forgotten chapter”

title: Union Minister Bhupathiraju Srinivasa Varma emphasises speedy completion of railway projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: He assures Central Government’s support for the development of the Vijayawada Division and swift completion of all pending projects

title: 'Not bulletproof': FATF warns Pakistan greylist exit does not shield from scrutiny
content: The FATF cautioned Pakistan that exiting the greylist doesn't grant immunity from scrutiny over money laundering or terrorist financing. Countries, including those delisted, must continue tightening safeguards against illicit financial activities, as terror groups reportedly exploit digital wallets and crypto channels for funding.

title: Watch: Diwali fireworks set homes on fire from New York to Canada
content: Illegal Diwali fireworks ignited devastating house fires in New York and Canada, rendering families homeless. In Queens, flames spread to three homes after fireworks landed on a residence. Edmonton also saw a family lose their house to a similar incident. Authorities are emphasizing strict enforcement of fireworks bans, even during cultural celebrations.

title: Singapore hospital: Indian nurse jailed over 1 year for molesting male visitor
content: An Indian nurse at Singapore's Raffles Hospital received a jail sentence of 14 months and two strokes of the cane for molesting a male visitor in a hospital toilet. The 34-year-old nurse, Elipe Siva Nagu, claimed he intended to 'disinfect' the victim. The incident, which occurred in June, caused the victim significant emotional distress.

title: Intel profitable again: How Trump's bet paid off; stock up 50%
content: Chip giant Intel has returned to profit after six quarters of losses. The company reported strong revenue in the third quarter, driven by high demand for its chips. This positive performance follows a significant investment from the US government. Intel expects this robust demand to continue through 2026. The company's client computing segment, which includes PC and laptop chips, saw a 5% year-over-year increase. Artificial intelligence is seen as a key driver for future growth.

title: ‘I will die’: UP man’s cry for help from Saudi goes viral; Indian embassy reacts
content: An Indian national from Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, has appealed for help in a viral video, claiming he is being held against his will in Saudi Arabia. The Indian Embassy is attempting to locate him but requires more details, urging the lawyer who posted the video to provide additional information.

title: IND vs AUS: Shubman Gill’s streak continues; India’s curse refuses to end
content: India faces another toss defeat, their 18th consecutive in ODIs, as Australia chose to bat first in the third match. Despite this, the team is reportedly comfortable bowling first.

title: Bengaluru hit-and-run case: Actor Divya Suresh identified as driver
content: Kannada actress Divya Suresh has been identified as the alleged driver in a hit-and-run incident in Byatarayanapura. The early morning accident on October 4th injured three individuals riding a motorcycle.  A speeding black car, reportedly driven by Suresh, struck the victims before fleeing the scene. Investigations are ongoing following the registration of a case.

title: OpenAI’s Airbnb ties: Brian Chesky to friend Sam Altman; can’t use ChatGPT right now
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.

title: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit passes away at 93; PM cancels trip to Asean
content: Queen Mother Sirikit of Thailand, a revered figure known for her rural development and conservation efforts, has passed away at age 93. Hospitalized since 2019 with various ailments, her condition worsened, leading to her death. She was the mother of the current King Vajiralongkorn and wife of the late King Bhumibol Adulyadej.

title: Chennai on high watch: Cyclone 'Montha' looms; IMD issue orange alert
content: Chennai and neighboring districts are bracing for heavy rainfall as the season's first cyclonic storm, potentially named Montha, takes shape over the Bay of Bengal. The IMD has issued an orange alert for October 27, forecasting significant downpours.

title: China's spy playbook: Seduce, marry tech workers; $600B trade secrets lost
content: Female spies have a long history, with recent reports alleging China and Russia are employing "sex warfare" to steal Silicon Valley secrets. Attractive operatives are reportedly seducing tech workers, even marrying them, to infiltrate the industry and acquire trade secrets. This tactic, alongside other methods like startup competitions and venture capital investments, highlights a growing espionage threat to American innovation.

title: 'Grave human rights violations’: India slams Pak at UNSC
content: India's UN envoy, Parvathaneni Harish, urged Pakistan to cease human rights violations in its "illegally occupied" territories, particularly Jammu and Kashmir. He reiterated that the region is an "integral and inalienable part of India," contrasting its democratic traditions with Pakistan's alleged repression.

title: Why fans are posting ‘RIP Ted Nivison’ on X- check truth behind rumors
content: YouTuber Ted Nivison trended on X with fake RIP messages. This was due to an old joke from 2022 resurfacing. His friend JSchlatt posted a tribute, sparking a viral meme. Nivison himself played along, confirming it was an inside joke. Fans reacted with humor and some concern over the spread of misinformation.

title: Washington attack: Four shot near Howard University campus; what we know so far
content: Four individuals were shot near Howard University during homecoming festivities on Friday evening. The incident occurred around 8:23 pm, with one victim in critical condition and another seriously injured. Police have secured the scene and are investigating, urging the public to avoid the area.

title: How Mohsin Naqvi-led PCB continues to hit new lows: A blow-by-blow account
content: PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi dominated headlines following India's Asia Cup triumph due to a series of controversies, including a handshake snub and a trophy presentation standoff. Naqvi's subsequent decisions, like appointing Shaheen Afridi as ODI captain and Shan Masood as a consultant, further fueled the turmoil.

title: US C'ship: Huge record! World No. 3 Caruana joins Fischer with 2025 title
content: Fabiano Caruana and Carissa Yip have clinched their US Chess Championship titles for 2025. Caruana secured his fifth overall championship with a fourth consecutive win, while Yip earned her fourth title with a third straight victory. Both champions displayed strategic prowess to maintain their leads and secure their dominant positions in the prestigious tournament.

title: Ayesha Curry stuns fans with custom Warriors gift amid divorce rumors
content: Stephen Curry kicked off the NBA season with a stellar performance, leading the Warriors to victory. Meanwhile, his wife Ayesha received a unique, custom-designed Warriors jersey from Kristin Juszczyk. Ayesha's social media posts, including one referencing "Year 17," sparked fan confusion, while recent divorce rumors were debunked, with Ayesha clarifying her past views on marriage and motherhood.

title: Former US cop shot himself, blamed a Black man, and faked it all to win back ex-girlfriend
content: A former New York State trooper staged his own shooting to impress his ex-girlfriend. Thomas Mascia faked a traffic stop attack on October 30, 2024. He insisted on being taken to the hospital where his former partner worked. This deception led to his job loss, reputation damage, and a six-month jail sentence. He also faces a significant restitution payment.

title: Pune horror: Woman strangles husband over domestic issue; arrested
content: A 29-year-old woman has been arrested in Pune for allegedly strangling her 40-year-old husband after a domestic dispute. The incident occurred early Friday morning following a heated argument. The wife, who was preparing to contest local elections, reportedly overpowered her husband and used a piece of cloth to strangle him. Their two young children were asleep during the altercation.

title: Another ex-Microsoft boss under fire for sending ‘animal genitalia’ pics to Epstein
content: Former Microsoft CTO Nathan Myhrvold faces scrutiny over a disturbing birthday letter allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein, reportedly containing graphic images.  The letter, revealed in a congressional report, referenced Epstein as a "lifestyle advisor." Myhrvold, who previously flew on Epstein's jet, now calls their connection a "passing acquaintance" and expresses regret.

title: Indian-origin man Umesh Patel sentenced to home detention in New Zealand
content: An Indian-origin Auckland man, Umesh Patel, has been sentenced to nine months of home detention for orchestrating an elaborate immigration fraud scheme. Patel created fake jobs and submitted fraudulent documents to Immigration New Zealand, charging applicants between NZD $10,000 and $30,000. The scheme, which ran for years, undermined the integrity of New Zealand's immigration system.

title: 'Will adapt ops': Refiners prepare for life without Russian oil; assessing US sanctions
content: Indian refiners, including Reliance Industries, are adjusting operations to comply with US sanctions on Russian crude exporters Rosneft and Lukoil. While state-run firms will absorb initial costs of finding alternative supplies at market rates, the impact on consumers is currently minimal. Refiners are preparing for a future without Russian oil, assessing compliance needs and potential market shifts.

title: Deal done: Blackstone to take 10% stake in Federal Bank; to acquire at Rs 6.2k cr
content: Blackstone is set to acquire nearly 10% stake in Federal Bank for Rs 6,196.5 crore, pending shareholder and regulatory approvals. This significant deal highlights a trend of Indian lenders attracting substantial private capital, fueling debate on the RBI's stance towards foreign strategic ownership in the banking sector.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo probable to play vs Raptors despite toe sprain
content: Milwaukee Bucks' superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors, managing a left great toe sprain. Despite this, the team is optimistic about his availability, though his minutes may be managed. Guard Kevin Porter Jr. remains out with an ankle injury, impacting the Bucks' rotation. The Raptors expect a competitive lineup led by Scottie Barnes.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf’s daughter Jaz introduces adorable new partner Copper
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf's daughter, Jaz, has introduced a new cocker spaniel puppy named Copper to the family, delighting fans. The legendary tennis couple's children are described as normal, with Jaz enjoying typical teenage outings and son Jaden pursuing baseball. Agassi emphasizes fatherhood as his most important role, cherishing his bond with his children.

title: Kevin Garnett caught in NBA gambling scandal as his name surfaces in probe
content: The FBI's investigation into illicit gambling and poker activities has intensified, leading to the arrest of NBA players Terry Rozier and former player Chauncey Billups. Hall of Famer Kevin Garnett is also reportedly linked to private poker games investigated by the FBI, though he has not been charged with any wrongdoing.

title: Andhra bus fire: Phones, elbows, laptops were tools of survival; narrow escape for many
content: A festive weekend trip turned terrifying for Hyderabad-Bengaluru bus passengers as flames engulfed their vehicle. Survivors recounted harrowing escapes, using fists and laptops to break windows and flee the inferno. Amidst panic, acts of courage and desperation unfolded as individuals fought for survival, leaving lasting impressions of the near-fatal ordeal.

title: Durgapur gang rape: Survivor identifies 5 accused; lawyer hails 'satisfactory results'
content: Durgapur gang rape survivor identified five accused during a Test Identification parade at the correctional home. The sixth accused, known to the survivor, was not part of the parade. The investigation is progressing well, with police focusing on the roles of those involved in the rape and subsequent extortion.

title: Emman Atienza: How did the TikTok star, daughter of Kuya Kim Atienza die at 19
content: TikTok creator Emman Atienza, 19, daughter of TV host Kim Atienza, passed away by suicide in Los Angeles on October 22. Known for her honest discussions on self-love and mental health, her passing has deeply affected her family, friends, and thousands of young followers who found solace in her online presence.

title: Another controversy? Following Asia Cup humiliation, Mohsin Naqvi stuns cricket world
content: Shan Masood is stepping down as Pakistan's Test captain after their recent defeat. He will now serve as the PCB's director of international cricket, a role he will combine with his playing duties. This appointment, however, raises questions regarding compliance with PCB regulations.

title: MLB Fall Classic 2025: World series schedule, streaming & matchup details
content: The 2025 World Series is underway with the Los Angeles Dodgers facing the Toronto Blue Jays. Shohei Ohtani powered the Dodgers in Game 1, while Vladimir Guerrero Jr. aims to lead the Blue Jays' comeback. Game 2 features a pitching matchup between Kevin Gausman and Yoshinobu Yamamoto as Toronto seeks to even the series.

title: EV share in car sales nearly doubles in year; rises to 5% - details
content: Electric vehicle adoption in India is accelerating, with sales nearly doubling in the first half of FY26 compared to the previous year. EVs now represent around 5% of total passenger vehicle sales, up from 2.6%. Major players like JSW MG Motor and Tata Motors are leading this surge, with luxury brands also reporting significant growth in their green car offerings.

title: India XI, toss, weather update from Sydney: Will Gill, Gambhir finally include Kuldeep?
content: India aims to avoid a series whitewash against Australia in the third ODI at Sydney after losing the first two matches. With Virat Kohli's form a concern and Kuldeep Yadav's potential inclusion, India seeks to end the tour on a high note. Australia, bolstered by Josh Inglis's return, eyes a 3-0 sweep.

title: 'Can't play together': Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir slammed for 'injustice'
content: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticised the decision to exclude Kuldeep Yadav from the ODIs against Australia, believing his absence cost India the second match. Kaif urged the team management to include either Harshit Rana or Nitish Kumar Reddy, questioning Rana's bowling strengths and effectiveness against cautious batting.

title: Longevity hack: 5 foods that everyone over 40 must consume everyday
content: The combination of healthy fats, protein, fiber, vitamins and antioxidants makes nuts, including almonds, walnuts and pistachios an excellent choice for nutrition. Research indicates that nut consumption leads to decreased chances of developing cardiovascular diseases and metabolic conditions which impact aging processes

title: MP carbide guns: Two cops sounded alarm; govt failed to take action
content: Two alert police officers in Gwalior and Bhopal filed FIRs days before Diwali after spotting illegal carbide gun sales, but these warnings went unheeded.  Despite these early actions, the dangerous weapons continued to be sold openly and online, leading to a "dark Diwali" tragedy with hundreds injured.  A subsequent crackdown seized numerous guns and explosives.

title: 'Your phones are on radar': Maharashtra BJP minister to party members; row erupts
content: Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule warned BJP workers about their mobile phones and WhatsApp groups being monitored, urging discipline ahead of local polls. Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut condemned this as a privacy breach, demanding the minister's arrest. Bawankule later clarified that the party links booth-level WhatsApp groups to its war room for communication and feedback.

title: Andhra, Rajasthan bus fires: 2 incidents in a month spark concerns; focus on strict safety norms
content: The tragic bus fires in Andhra and Rajasthan, which have taken the lives of more than 40 individuals, have sparked urgent discussions around passenger safety. As authorities roll out stricter bus body regulations, including the incorporation of fire alarms and emergency exits, significant challenges remain due to outdated vehicles and insufficient local enforcement.

title: Thyroid cancer: Simple lifestyle tweaks that can help prevent the risk
content: Preventing thyroid cancer is now possible through lifestyle changes. Maintaining a healthy weight, limiting radiation exposure, and adopting a plant-rich diet are crucial. Avoiding tobacco and being aware of early signs like neck swelling or hoarseness are also vital. Stress management and targeted screening for high-risk individuals further bolster prevention efforts.

title: 'A fact': Sangh toppled Karpoori govt, says Cong; accuses RSS of 'abusing' ex-Bihar CM
content: Congress questioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Karpoori Thakur's ancestral village, alleging that the Jan Sangh, BJP's predecessor, had previously opposed Thakur's government over OBC reservations. The party also criticized Modi's stance on caste census and the protection of Bihar's reservation laws.

title: Thailand PM Cancels ASEAN Trip After Queen Mother Sirikit's Death
content: Thailand's prime minister cancelled his trip to Malaysia ahead of the ASEAN Summit on Saturday due to the death of the kingdom's Queen Mother Sirikit, and may miss the signing of a ceasefire deal with Cambodia.

title: Hamas, Palestinian Factions Agree To Hand Gaza To Technocrat Panel
content: The main Palestinian political factions, including Hamas, said Friday they had agreed that an independent committee of technocrats would take over the running of post-war Gaza.

title: India, Pakistan Were On Brink Of War In 2002, Claims Ex-CIA Officer
content: Ex-CIA Officer John Kiriakou said that ex-Pak President Pervez Musharraf just kept the military 'happy,' and pretended to side with the US on counterterrorism while carrying out terrorist activities against India.

title: Telangana Minister Blames Driver, Travel Company For Kurnool Bus Fire
content: The devastating bus fire near Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool early Friday that killed 19 people has exposed a dangerous cocktail of human error, corporate negligence, and blatant safety violations that plague the private interstate travel sector.

title: Secret Picasso Portrait Of Longtime Muse Dora Maar Sold For $37 Million
content: A vividly hued Picasso portrait of longtime muse and partner Dora Maar that had remained hidden from public view for more than eight decades sold Friday at auction for32 million euros (about $37million)

title: Osama bin Laden Escaped Disguised As A Woman: Ex-CIA Officer
content: Translator for the commander of Central Command was actually an "Al Qaeda operative who had infiltrated the US military," said former CIA Officer John Kiriakou.

title: In 4-Page Suicide Note, Doctor Who Was Raped Accused MP Of Pressuring Her
content: The doctor who died by suicide in Maharashtra's Satara and accused a police officer of raping her four times also left behind a four-page suicide letter in which she said she was pressured to issue fake fitness certificates of accused in police cases

title: Queen Sirikit, Whose Birthday Was Celebrated As Thailand's Mother's Day, Dies
content: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit, who supervised royal projects to help the rural poor, preserve traditional craft-making and protect the environment, died on Friday. She was 93.

title: Speeding SUV Runs Over People In Agra, 5 Dead. Locals Thrash Driver
content: According to officials, the Tata Nexon car first hit a bike and then a divider before veering off and ramming into a group of people standing on the roadside.

title: Indian Nurse Jailed For Molesting Male Visitor At Singapore Hospital
content: An Indian national working as a staff nurse at Raffles Hospital in Singapore was sentenced to a year and two months' jail, and two strokes of the cane after he pleaded guilty to a molestation charge.

title: "We Saw Her Off At Bus Stand": Andhra Bus Fire Leaves Families Devastated
content: The air around Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool bus accident site is thick, not just with the stench of smoke, but with the palpable grief of shattered families. The devastating fire that consumed the ill-fated bus has turned young dreams into cinders

title: "End Grave Human Rights Violations": India Slams Pakistan At UN
content: Jammu and Kashmir has been, is, and will always be an integral and inalienable part of India, said Parvathaneni Harish, India's Permanent Representative to the UN, while hitting at Pak.

title: Early Voting For New York's Next Mayor Begins With Mamdani As Top Contender
content: Early voting for New York's next mayor begins Saturday with an outsider Democratic Party candidate the favorite to upend the city's politics and face down President Donald Trump, who has repeatedly attacked him.

title: Exit From Grey List Not Bulletproof Against Terror Financing: Global Watchdog FATF Warns Pak
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF), the global terror funding watchdog, has warned Pakistan that its removal from the 'greylist' in October 2022 doesn't make it immune to money laundering and terrorist financing.

title: "I Would Choose Death Over Returning To RJD": Tej Pratap Yadav
content: Former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav on Friday asserted that he will "choose death over returning to the RJD", from which he was expelled by his father Lalu Prasad a few months ago.

title: UP Minister Narrowly Escapes Road Accident After Truck Hits Her Car
content: Uttar Pradesh Minister for Women Welfare and Child Development, Baby Rani Maurya, narrowly escaped a road accident on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday night.

title: Venezuela's Maduro Says US "Fabricating War" As Trump Sends Warship
content: Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro asserted Friday the United States was "fabricating a war" as Washington sent an aircraft carrier to the Caribbean, building up a military deployment there.

title: Canada Says Ready To Engage After Trump Ends Trade Talks Over Ad Dispute
content: Canadian PM Mark Carney has said that his government remains ready to continue "constructive discussions" with the United States after US President Donald Trump abruptly announced the termination of trade negotiations between the two countries.

title: IMF Projects Indian Economy To Grow At 6.6% In Financial Year 2025
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has predicted that India will continue to be one of the fastest-growing 'emerging market and developing economies' in 2025-26, growing at a rate of 6.6%, according to the World Economic Outlook (WEO) report.

title: Trump Considering Plans To Target Drug Facilities Inside Venezuela: Report
content: United States President Donald Trump is considering plans to target cocaine facilities and drug trafficking routes in Venezuela. However, no official plan has been made, US officials said, as reported by CNN.

title: Coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the Dallas Wings , New York Liberty and Seattle Storm cut ties with their head coaches following the 2025 season . the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire joined the WNBA next year . a day later, the Storm filled their open position by hiring from the college ranks . now, there's just one head coaching position open, at new york .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 8
content: Mike Clay explains why he's a lineup lock against the Cowboys . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . we have folded the Shadow Reports into the game-by-game breakdowns here .

title: A well-done steak for Deion, medium for Dabo: How CFB chefs please everyone's palates
content: in 2019, he was the executive chef of the Seattle Seahawks . he had applied for a culinary position with LSU before where he would be working at Tiger Stadium . in his interview, he cooked for 35 people -- executives, dieticians and other high-ranking officials .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: How Giannis and the Bucks managed an awkward offseason
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appeared on a projector screen in the interview room . it was the first day a team could officially gather before the start of training camp . he had come down with COVID the week before and had not been cleared to travel .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: Round 1 preview, predictions: Can anyone stop Philly?
content: the 2025 MLS Cup playoffs kicked off on Wednesday with the wild card round, which saw the ninth seeds from both the East and West get knocked out . this phase of the postseason moves quickly, with the dust on Wednesday's Wild Card games having barely settled before inter Miami and Nashville SC get Round 1 underway on Friday night . the 'futbol Americas' crew debate who's the leading contenders to win the MLS cup .

content: the college football season has been good at shutting down fun upstart stories . it's been a good week for a college football team to declutter this season . if you're playing a Texas A&M team in Baton Rouge, you'll be able to get to the top of the polls .

title: 'Can wear hijab': HC's relief for Kerala student; welcomes 'better sense'
content: a bench of justice V G Arun closed the petition . the petition was filed by the manager of the school in palluruthy . it challenged a notice directing the school authorities to permit a girl student to attend classes wearing a headscarf .

title: Week 9 preview: Conference title contenders, key matchups and more
content: a conference in the country has a clear-cut front-runner . there are 60 FBS schools with no more than one conference loss . it's not even just the sheer volume of contenders, but the surprising teams in the mix .

title: NBA Cup: Court designs for 2025 edition of the tournament
content: the Emirates NBA Cup 2025 is around the corner -- games tip off on Oct. 31 . each team will play four group-play games on designated "Cup Nights" eight teams will advance to the knockout rounds, with a chance to win the trophy .

title: 2025 World Series: Takeaways from Blue Jays' dominant Game 1 win over Dodgers
content: the Toronto Blue Jays came out swinging in Game 1 in front of a roaring crowd . it was the highest-scoring inning in postseason history -- and featured the first pinch-hit grand slam in world Series history . the first game of the fall Classic in Toronto featured in-game analysis to takeaways .

title: 👀 Wetzel: The next betting scandal is coming
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .
